segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge, making the floor a slippery hazard.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’s been like this and why she hasn’t turned off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to something, but she’s too focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost feel the tension in the air, like something bad is about to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between her calmness and the chaos around her is almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone notices before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like nothing is wrong inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t heard the water splashing everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
